ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course focused on analyzing what economic inequality looks like from many different fronts. It addresses causes of inequality on the social, socio-economic, cultural level. It hints on poverty and poverty alleviation. It also delves into methods to combat inequality and much more. The course really pushes one to think beyond the standard intuition of good and bad, right and wrong, effective and ineffective, etc.
Global economic inequality's historical evolution, metrics, theories, causes and effects, possible solutions especially fiscal and taxation policy and its efficacy.
I learned about different measures of inequality, the origins of inequality in the modern world, the broad effects of inequality on society, and the ways in which we can combat inequality.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This is a discussion based class that really allows people to share their opinions and thoughts while listening to others. You learn a lot from the texts read and are able to apply your own knowledge to the topics for discussion purposes. It can be really interesting depending on the topic and how people participate.

Strengths: small class size, expert professor, interesting readings, independent assignments that allow you to explore topics of specific interest to you Weaknesses: could learn more about methodologies
Spend less time on The Spirit Level. More feedback from professor.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It's a great course about economic inequality! Do all the readings and be engaged and you will get a lot out of the course!
Please take this class, please do!
Yes--very interesting class, manageable workload, great professor.
I would recommend this class to anyone interested in inequality who would like a broad overview of the concept.
